alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 10:48PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN KIMBLE COUNTY THROUGH 1130 PM CDT... At 1048 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of I-10 Near The Kimble-Kerr County Line, or 9 miles east of Segovia, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Segovia, The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290, and I-10 Near The Kimble-Kerr County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 462 and 477. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in San Angelo. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Texas.
